steps: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
Pour 2 oz of gin over the ice.
Add 4 oz of tonic water to the glass.
Gently stir to mix the ingredients.
Garnish with a lime wedge on the rim of the glass.
drink_image_description: A crystal-clear highball glass filled with ice cubes, showing the sparkling effervescence of tonic water mixed with the pale, translucent gin. A fresh green lime wedge is perched elegantly on the rim. The photo is taken from a slight top angle with soft natural lighting highlighting the bubbles and condensation on the glass, set against a bright, clean background.
drink_history: The Gin and Tonic originated during the British colonial period in India. British officers mixed quinine tonic, which was used to prevent malaria, with gin to make it more palatable. This drink has since become a classic refreshing cocktail worldwide.

flavor_profile.finish: Clean and crisp with a slight bitterness
flavor_profile.balance: Well balanced between the botanicals of gin and the bitterness of tonic with a citrus brightness

serving_size_base.batch_preparation_notes: Use a larger pitcher and add ice last to keep the drink fizzy.

enhanced_steps.action: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Use fresh, large ice cubes to keep the drink cold without diluting it quickly.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Glass should be almost full of ice.

enhanced_steps.action: Pour 2 oz of gin over the ice.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Measure accurately with a jigger for consistency.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Gin should sit clearly on top of the ice.

enhanced_steps.action: Add 4 oz of tonic water to the glass.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Bubbles should be visible rising through the liquid.

enhanced_steps.action: Gently stir to mix the ingredients.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Use a bar spoon to stir carefully to avoid losing carbonation.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Liquid should be well mixed but still bubbly.
common_mistakes: Stirring too vigorously and losing fizz.

enhanced_steps.action: Garnish with a lime wedge on the rim of the glass.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Express the lime oils over the drink by gently squeezing before placing the wedge.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Lime wedge perched neatly on the rim.

suggested_variations.name: Cucumber Gin and Tonic
changes: Add a slice of cucumber as garnish
Optionally muddle cucumber lightly in the glass before adding gin
suggested_variations.description: A refreshing twist with cool cucumber notes enhancing the botanical flavors.

suggested_variations.name: Herbal Gin and Tonic
changes: Add a sprig of rosemary or thyme as garnish
suggested_variations.description: Adds an aromatic herbal complexity to the classic drink.

skill_level_recommendation: Perfect for beginners and expert bartenders alike due to its simplicity and elegance.
